Articles.Content:
This things full name is Sukoi Pak FA t-50, so I don't really know its short name. Anyways, I created a replica of the Russian fighter jet t-50. Ever since 0.25, modeling and building things has changed, and building things in detail has become very different and people like me and others will have to experiment around with this new wing system to find out tricks for certain goals. One thing I can say about the new wings is that they really easily show the clipping of wings, which we will have to find something against. In this design I have created the t-50 while trying to keep wing clipping to a minimum. As for all of my crafts, this jet is really stable and agile (especially for its size). I used Kerbpaint for the colored wings (their still stock), Hotrockets for the cool exhaust (still stock), and bdarmory for the cluster bomb (not stock, but isn't included in the download).

Download

Edited October 11, 2014 by manni01
Nice one, but not sure if coincidence, or just illuminati (jk). I mean, we both finished a replica of the PAK-FA/T-50 on the same day, without knowing eachother, lol. Good job buddy

Looks cool I've seen another one on here. Mine looks a bit simpler than both of them. I guess mine is a bit more round and your's more shaped correctly. I wonder how agile your's is... *tries to find an excuse for other people's crafts being more detailed*
It's pretty agile actually, but yours has probably 60 or so parts, while mine has 220+. Haha
More friendly towards weaker computers (I'm pretty sure mine is one of the worst out there; mid 2008 macbook pro, lowest specs. All I have is a custom hardrive )
